alert.note: Alert for North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 4:10AM PST until January 04 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding expected. * WHERE...North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From noon today to 3 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level, during high tides is expected in the low lying areas near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Similar conditions in the past have resulted in minor flooding of Highway 101 near Seaside, Nehalem, and/or Tillamook. Water has covered parts of Frazier Rd, Miami Foley Rd at milepost 1, the intersection near Alderbrook and Possetti road. There has also been flooding in the town of Rockaway Beach and Pacific City Airport. Flooding extent will be less than Monday`s event. -Total tide (astronomical tide with storm surge) at Tongue Point in Astoria is forecast to peak near 11 feet at 2 PM. -Total tide at Garibaldi is forecast to peak near 10.5 feet at 1 PM.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water.
